intro: Cheiridopsis aurea, commonly known as the golden ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves that form a dense mat. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the summer months, which are borne on short stalks. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a rock garden plant.
